div.p: No. 3970, unit 23, pp. 654-5, VPRS 1187/P letters outwards October-December 1870, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office of Victoria, Melbourne.

I am directed by the Honorable the Chief Secretary to inform you, that you have been appointed by the Governor in Council the Chairman of a Board consisting of the gentlemen named in the margin
The names listed in the margin are W. Hammill, W. J. Greig, Josiah Mitchell and W. Sangster. to inquire into and advise the Government upon the best mode of reorganizing the department of the Botanic Gardens.

The general direction which the Government desires the inquiry should take will apparent to a Board by the perusal of the enclosed extract from the minute laid before the Governor in Council on which the Order in Council was issued directing the appointment of the Board. But it is not intended that the Board should consider itself debarred from extending its investigation into any other branch of the subject that may come under view during the progress of the inquiry.
Sir James McCulloch requests that you will place yourself in communication with the other members of the Board and enter upon the inquiry at the earliest convenience of all concerned.
